main.name: Gabriel Granata
description: Lover of software, people, and problems.
main.bio: I'm a third year Software Engineering student working his third co-op term at BMO Capital Markets in Toronto. I've spent my university career working with others and growing as a developer. Participating in over 5 hackathons with different groups of people, experimenting with different technologies and languages. My main skillset is centred around web and app development, recently taking an interest in machine and deep learning.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: BASc in Software Engineering (Co-Op), Management & Entrepeneurship Option
education.description: Hackathon winner. Dean's Honour List recipient. Former faculty council member.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Intern on the Cross-Asset Solutions - Linked Notes Structuring desk.

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
description: As an intern on the Fixed Income and Canadian Commodities desk (Swaps and Bonds), I developed multiple internal tools to increase the efficiency of the in-house workflow.

I developed on the .NET framework, experimenting with different C# technologies and exploring data structures and algorithms such as dependency graphs and event-based programming. This included automating everyday Excel tasks for the team, generating price calculations and updating SQL databases for other teams, as well as exploring the message queue structure that BMO uses for their everyday trading.

For my term-ending project, I developed a large dependency graph for explicit and implicit bond prices. By employing recursive and event-based techniques, and using graphing structures, I was able to lower the memory usage of the solution from 8 GB to just over 200 MB. This heavily lowered CPU usage and the product was able to be implemented across multiple teams.

work.title: DevOps SRE Intern
description: I completed my internship at Mitel as a member of the CloudLink DevOps team as a Site Reliability Engineer. The team was focused on the infrastructure and pipeline of Mitel's solutions.

I begun the term performing QA automation tasks, such as testing multiple websites developed on Angular using testing tools such as Jasmine, Selenium, and Protractor. All of my programming was done in TypeScript to ensure compatibility across browsers and ES versions. I was also tasked with automating the testing of different PBX phone systems, automating SSH and web portal tasks.

After completing my testing work on the QA team, I was tasked with developing a lambda function on AWS for nightly backups. This involved migrating a previous Batch implementation to a Lambda implementation, running on the Node.JS environment, to perform ElasticSearch and DynamoDB backups.

expertise.name: Web Development
expertise.description: Full Stack web development skillset developed through experience developing at hackathons, for side projects, and completing online courses such as The Web Developer Bootcamp offered on Udemy.

expertise.name: App Development
expertise.description: App development skillset developed through experience at hackathons and working on side projects. Completed the Flutter A-Z course online on Udemy.

expertise.name: Algorithm Development
expertise.description: Years of programming experience have resulted in me being able to improve my algorithm development skills, from University courses, to completing technical interviews, to applying these skills in projects and at previous internships.

expertise.name: Machine Learning
expertise.description: Currently improving my knowledge of machine learning by diving into Machine Learning: A-Z, a course offered on Udemy.com. Exploring topics such as regression, clustering, and reinforcement learning.

expertise.name: Deep Learning
expertise.description: Learning about the components of deep learning and neural networks through online coursework - Deep Learning: A-Z, offered on Udemy.com

expertise.name: Quality Assurance
expertise.description: Developed testing experience with multiple languages and frameworks through University courses - such as Software QA - and through internships - such as at Mitel.

projects.title: Stock Clock
projects.category: Google chrome extension centred around stock market pricing alerts. Developed using JavaScript and Google API. Currently >20 active users.

projects.title: Ez-Transfer
projects.category: Android app developed to create easy cryptocurrency transfers on the Algorand blockchain. Developed using Android studio and a Node.JS backend. This project also involved the investigation of Algorand's SDK, and eventual debugging. The app resulted in a second place finish at the hackathon.

projects.title: Packing Heat
projects.category: Flutter Android / iOS application developed to practice Flutter and the use of the Google Maps API to develop a full-stack map application for product deliveries. Winner of the Top 20 Wolfram Award at uOttahack 3 (2020).

projects.title: Exam Goat
projects.category: A React based standardized coding testing website developed to practice Firebase.

projects.title: Call Centre
